==Events==
* [[534]] &ndash; A second and final revision of the ''[[Corpus Juris Civilis#Codex Justinianus|Codex Justinianus]]'' is published.
*[[1272]] &ndash; While travelling during the [[Ninth Crusade]], [[Edward I of England|Prince Edward]] becomes [[King of England]] upon [[Henry III of England]]'s death, but he will not return to England for nearly two years to assume the throne.
*[[1491]] &ndash; An [[auto-da-fé]], held in the Brasero de la Dehesa outside of [[Ávila, Spain|Ávila]], concludes the case of the [[Holy Child of La Guardia]] with the public execution of several [[Jewish]] and [[converso]] suspects.
*[[1532]] &ndash; [[Francisco Pizarro]] and his men capture [[Inca Empire|Inca]] Emperor [[Atahualpa]] at the [[Battle of Cajamarca]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: British and [[Hessian (soldiers)|Hessian]] units [[Battle of Fort Washington|capture]] [[Fort Washington (New York)|Fort Washington]] from the Patriots.
*  1776   &ndash; American Revolution: The [[Dutch Republic|United Provinces (Low Countries)]] recognize the independence of the United States.
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: Ninety anti-republican Catholic priests are [[Drownings at Nantes|executed by drowning]] at [[Nantes]].
*[[1805]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Battle of Schöngrabern]] &ndash; Russian forces under [[Pyotr Bagration]] delay the pursuit by French troops under [[Joachim Murat]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[American Old West]]: [[Missouri]] trader [[William Becknell]] arrives in [[Santa Fe, New Mexico]], over a route that became known as the [[Santa Fe Trail]].
*[[1828]] &ndash; [[Greek War of Independence]]: The [[London Protocol (1828)|London Protocol]] entails the creation of an autonomous Greek state under Ottoman suzerainty, encompassing the [[Morea]] and the [[Cyclades]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; A Russian court sentences writer [[Fyodor Dostoevsky]] to death for anti-government activities linked to a radical intellectual group; his sentence is later commuted to hard labor.
*[[1852]] &ndash; The English astronomer [[John Russell Hind]] discovers the asteroid [[22 Kalliope]].
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Siege of Lucknow|Second relief of Lucknow]] &ndash; twenty-four [[Victoria Cross]]es are awarded, the most in a single day.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Campbell's Station]] near [[Knoxville, Tennessee]] &ndash; [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops unsuccessfully attack [[United States|Union]] forces.
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Canadians|Canadian]] rebel leader of the [[Métis people|Métis]] and "Father of [[Manitoba]]" [[Louis Riel]] is executed for [[treason]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; English engineer [[John Ambrose Fleming]] receives a patent for the [[vacuum tube|thermionic valve]] (vacuum tube).
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[Indian Territory]] and [[Oklahoma Territory]] join to form [[Oklahoma]], which is admitted as the 46th U.S. state.
*  1907   &ndash; [[Cunard Line|Cunard]] Line's {{RMS|Mauretania|1906|6}}, sister ship of {{RMS|Lusitania}}, sets sail on her maiden voyage from [[Liverpool]], England, to New York City.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Federal Reserve Bank]] of the United States officially opens.
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Qantas]], Australia's national airline, [[History of Qantas|is founded]] as Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services Limited.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Lysergic acid diethylamide|LSD]] is first synthesized by [[Swiss people|Swiss]] [[Chemistry|chemist]] Dr. [[Albert Hofmann]] at the [[Sandoz Laboratories]] in [[Basel]], Switzerland.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: In response to the [[Coventry Blitz|leveling of Coventry]] by the German [[Luftwaffe]] two days before, the [[Royal Air Force]] bombs [[Hamburg]].
*  1940   &ndash; [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]]: In occupied Poland, the [[Nazism|Nazis]] close off the [[Warsaw Ghetto]] from the outside world.
*  1940   &ndash; New York City's "Mad Bomber" [[George Metesky]] places his first bomb at a [[Manhattan]] office building used by [[Consolidated Edison]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: American bombers strike a [[hydro-electric power]] facility and [[heavy water]] factory in German-controlled [[Vemork]], Norway.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Operation Queen]], the costly Allied thrust to the [[Rur]], is launched.
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[Dueren]], Germany, is destroyed by [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] bombers.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[UNESCO]] is founded.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Venera program]]: The [[Soviet Union]] launches the ''[[Venera 3]]'' space probe toward [[Venus]], which will be the first [[spacecraft]] to reach the surface of another [[planet]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Skylab]] program: [[NASA]] launches ''[[Skylab 4]]'' with a crew of three [[astronaut]]s from [[Cape Canaveral, Florida]] for an 84-day mission.
*  1973   &ndash; U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] signs the [[Trans-Alaska Pipeline Authorization Act]] into law, authorizing the construction of the [[Alaska Pipeline]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; The first line of [[Bucharest Metro]] (Line M1) is opened from [[Timpuri Noi metro station|Timpuri Noi]] to [[Petrache Poenaru metro station|Semănătoarea]] in [[Bucharest]], Romania.
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Soviet]] of the [[Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic]] [[Estonian Sovereignty Declaration|declares]] that [[Estonia]] is "sovereign" but stops short of declaring independence.
*  1988   &ndash; In the first open election in more than a decade, voters in [[Pakistan]] elect populist candidate [[Benazir Bhutto]] to be [[Prime Minister of Pakistan]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; A [[death squad]] composed of El Salvadoran army troops [[Murder of UCA scholars|kills]] six [[Society of Jesus|Jesuit]] priests and two others at [[Central American University|Jose Simeon Canas University]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Hoxne Hoard]] is discovered by [[metal detector]]ist Eric Lawes in [[Hoxne]], Suffolk.
*[[1997]] &ndash; After nearly 18 years of incarceration, the People's Republic of China releases [[Wei Jingsheng]], a pro-democracy dissident, from jail for medical reasons.
